trigger_event: Sven, troubled after a tense exchange with Alex the bartender about the eerie uniformity of restored citizens, discovers Council debates growing frantic over public unrest and anomalous behavior.
dilemma: Should Sven urge immediate public quarantines of affected city blocks—risking mass panic but seizing control of the narrative—or covertly manipulate the scoring algorithms to target high-ranking officials, letting the system quietly purge the elite in favor of the restored?
reason: Sven is caught between his duty to maintain public trust through messaging and his desire to keep the system adaptive and resilient. Either path risks public chaos—one through visible crisis, the other through silent internal upheaval. His skills make him the Council’s voice but also the architect of hidden shifts; the wrong message or concealed action could unravel the entire order.
choice_a: Institute public quarantines of suspicious neighborhoods, openly addressing the crisis—even if it means triggering panic and unrest.
belief_a: Visibility reassures the population’s anxieties, even when it sparks fear.
Nothing can be truly hidden for long.
choice_b: Surreptitiously adjust the BCI scoring algorithm to purge influential elites while shielding restored citizens, quietly shifting power with no public spectacle.
belief_b: The greatest dangers hide within the entrenched elite.
Lasting change must come before mass understanding.
